member.name: M:FactionColonies.LordJob_DeliverSupplies.DeliveryToFightTransition(Verse.AI.Group.StateGraph)
member.summary: This Transition switches the delivery Pawns from delivery mode to fighting mode. It drops their items if they carry any and notifies the player of what's about to happen
member.returns: the Transition

member.name: M:FactionColonies.LordJob_DeliverSupplies.RefreshFightTransition(Verse.AI.Group.StateGraph)
member.summary: This Transition fixes a bug, where sometimes some Pawns don't get transitioned into this phase even though they should tbh, I (dani) don't know if this is still needed, but it doesn't seem to hurt being there either
member.returns: the Transition

member.name: M:FactionColonies.LordJob_DeliverSupplies.FightingToLeavingTransition(Verse.AI.Group.StateGraph)
member.summary: Transitions from fighting to leaving, when the map has been peaceful for 1000 ticks
member.returns: the Transition

member.name: M:FactionColonies.LordJob_DeliverSupplies.LeavingToFightTransition(Verse.AI.Group.StateGraph)
member.summary: This Transition switches the delivery Pawns from leaving mode to fighting mode. It notifies the player of what's about to happen
member.returns: the Transition

member.name: M:FactionColonies.LordJob_DeliverSupplies.CanNotDeliverToLeavingTransition(Verse.AI.Group.StateGraph)
member.summary: This Transition covers the case in which the delivering pawns can't find a path to the delivery tax spot, for example if the locks mod is used. Without this transition, pawns end up dropping their delivery and starving to death
member.returns: the Transition

member.name: T:FactionColonies.WorldSettlementFC
member.summary: WorldObject that in many ways re-implements Settlement.cs from Rimworld.Planet. May cause compatibility issues with other mods that rely on finding Settlement objects on the world map. Recommend testing this extensively with mods like SoS2, RimWar, or any mods that modify, collect, or deep save world objects before publishing changes

member.name: F:FactionColonies.WorldSettlementFC.destroyFlag
member.summary: A flag meant to indicate whether or not this settlement is meant for actual destruction; used to override WorldObject.Destroy() for compatibility purposes

member.summary: Indicate that this should be destroyed when WorldObject.Destroy() is called

member.name: M:FactionColonies.WorldSettlementFC.Destroy
member.summary: Compatibility focused: this object should only be destroyed very deliberately, else another object is likely trying to handle negative combat resolution against this settlement.
